text: Matrix multiplication in one step * map: + for each m;; produce <(i, k), (M, j, mij)> for all k + for each ny, produce <(i, k), (N, j,n;)> for all i * reduce: « each key (i, k) will have an associated list with all the values (M, j, mij) and (N, j,my) forall j * Must match up (M, j,mij) and (N, j, nx) for each j (sort by j) * Multiply the third components and sum these up to obtain py « Output <(i,k),pu> * Not necessarily faster
